verses.plain: Is there not an appointed time to man upon earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling?

tokens.t: not an appointed time to man upon earth?
his days also like the days of an hireling?

verses.plain: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work:

tokens.t: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for
his work:

verses.plain: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

tokens.t: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

verses.plain: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.

tokens.t: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.

verses.plain: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

tokens.t: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

verses.plain: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.

tokens.t: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.

verses.plain: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.

tokens.t: O remember that my life
wind: mine eye shall no more see good.

verses.plain: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.

tokens.t: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no
thine eyes
upon me, and I
not.

verses.plain: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.

tokens.t: the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no

verses.plain: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.

tokens.t: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.

verses.plain: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

tokens.t: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

verses.plain: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?

tokens.t: I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?

verses.plain: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;

tokens.t: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;

verses.plain: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:

tokens.t: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:

verses.plain: So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.

tokens.t: So that my soul chooseth strangling,
death rather than my life.

verses.plain: I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.

tokens.t: I loathe
I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days
vanity.

verses.plain: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?

tokens.t: What
man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?

verses.plain: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?

tokens.t: And
thou shouldest visit him every morning,
try him every moment?

verses.plain: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

tokens.t: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

verses.plain: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

tokens.t: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

verses.plain: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.

tokens.t: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I
not

footnotes.text: the night…: Heb. the evening be measured?
see: to see, that is, to enjoy
I am…: that is, I can live no longer
